intro: Secamone humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's secamone, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
